text:
Hi Food Tube Brazil the Food Tube in Portuguese,
it's brilliant, we're in the middle of Summer

in Brazil the Brazilians love barbeque love
it's almost a religion we call it shuhascu

in Portuguese and the most famous beef cut
in Brazil is picanha that is the rump cap

fat on I will be serving picanha with another
really famous side dish in Brazil that is

farofa farofa is basically made with toasted
cassava flour this recipe has butter bacon

eggs red onions black olives but you can put
everything that you want it's tremendously

good to absorb the juices from the beef I'm
starting the fire I'm using charcoal today

and if you ask me what's the perfect temperature
my favourite is a temperature that you and

put your hand over the grill and handle it
face down for 5 seconds if you can handle

5 seconds the temperature is perfect I will
start searing with the fat up why because

I don't want flames here one of my favourite
music is now beautiful isn't it so it will

be seared for maybe 4-5 minutes and then you
rest a little bit let's start the farofa we

are starting with the bacon searing and lightly
frying and after that we are going to remove

the bacon from the pan and use the fat to
fry the eggs some salt some pepper and delicious

the eggs are smelling amazing well we remove
the eggs and let it rest a little bit before

chopping farofa needs butter, I'm always using
unsalted butter the ratio is one part butter

to two and a half parts of toasted cassava
flour adding those delicious red onions we're

gonna make the onions soft and tender and
lightly brown time to put the bacon back with

the butter and with the onions let's shake
it a little bit add the flour toasted cassava

flour you can find in Brazil in stores, food
stores let's shake it a little bit let's add

the fried eggs black olives some salt fresh
parsley from our green garden shake it a little

bit and it's delicious and ready the picanha
was seared and rested for maybe 15 minutes

something like that and now I'm portioning
on strips two fingers thick so now I'm going

to salt, season with salt a little bit of
salt not too much, black pepper, here we are

and let's grill those beauties brushing with
the fat we're about temperature it's all about

internal temperature if you want it medium
rare, my favourite, the temperature should

be close to 55-57 degrees something like that
if you want medium 60-62 something close to

this what I use to do I use to, to remove
my steak from the grill when it's 53-54, why?

Because it's still cooking outside of the
grill in the first seconds so if I remove

53-54 that will be closer 56 in the resting
time before cool down ok so resting is really

really really important when you are grilling
a steak or meat, meat needs to rest a few

minutes before slice it's the time the juices
return to centre and become really really

tasty delicious and beautiful, the colour
becomes beautiful, if you don't have a thermometre

well you can use your hand this is raw, the
same feeling raw, rare, medium, medium well,

well done, it's the feeling that you have
when you touch the beef so it works it's not

so accurate as the thermometre but works now
we are going to let it rest for 3-4 minutes

under the foil to try to keep some of the
temperature and after that what I'm looking

for is the medium rare cook it inside yep
this is what I was looking for equally cooked

like this ready to eat let's see what we have
here almost, this is Food Tube Brazil thank
you, thank you so much it's delicious!
